title: The Natural (+Intelligence)
description: When you Seek Insight, you may roll +Intelligence instead of +Wisdom and add "What opportunity does no one else see?" to the list of possible questions.

title: A Life of Crime
description: You start with either Burgle or Light Fingers (your choice) as an extra move and either burglar tools or a hidden stash (your choice) as an additional special possession.

title: The Prodigal Returned (+Charisma)
description: When you declare that you know someone outside of Stonetop, someone who can help, name them and roll.

outcomes.text: Yeah they can help (tell us why they're willing).
They can help but pick 1 from the list below:
bullets: They still hold a grudge
They're going to need something from you first
They swore off this sort of thing a long time ago
You can't exactly, y'know, trust them

outcomes.text: The GM chooses 1 and then some

title: Pick 2
pick: Burglar's Kit: picks, files snippers, wire, ◇ prybars, ◇ hacksaws, ◇ a lantern.
Carpenter's tools: chisels, files nails, pitch, ◇ prybars, ◇ saws, ◇◇ firkins, barrels, etc
Distillery: skins of fine whisky (2 uses, grants advantage to Persuade), copper tubes, malt, ◇◇ firkins, stills, barrels, etc.
Hidden Stash: 3 uses, each use produces valuables worth a purse of silvers
Mummer's kit: juggling balls, whirlybird seeds, motley, ribbons, bells, ◇ puppets, ◇ a fiddle etc.
Scribe's tools: parchment, inks, pigments, vials, quills, ◇ a notebook, etc.
Tannery (or access to it): lime, acid, salts, thick gloves, ◇ a boilrd leather cuirass (1 Armor), etc.
Trading contacts: small amounts of salt, glass, silk, spice, medicinal herbs, pigments, ivory, etc

title: Dabbler - (Requires level 2+ and the Fox)
description: Each time you take this move, learn a new skill from Heavy, Marshal, Ranger, or Seeker

title: Danger Sense (+Intelligence)
description: You can always ask the GM, "Is there an ambush or trap here?" If they say "yes", roll +Intelligence.

outcomes.text: Ask the GM both of the questions below
bullets: What will trigger the ambush or trap?
What will happen once its triggered?

outcomes.text: Don't mark XP; you know there's a trap or ambush, but nothing bad happens just yet.

title: Skill at Arms (+Dexterity)
description: When you wield a weapon with speed and grace, roll +Dexterity to Clash (instead of +Strength).

title: Silver Tongued (+Charisma)
description: When you use words to avoid suspicion or trouble, roll +Charisma.

bullets: Move about or maneuver unchallenged
Withstand direct scrutiny or questioning
Direct suspicion or attention elsewhere

title: Laugh at Danger (+Charisma)
description: When you are about to roll +Constitution and you make a joke about the adversity you face, you can roll +Charisma instead.

title: Rapier Wit
description: When you pierce an NPC's pride with a well-placed quip, they must do 1 (their choice):

bullets: Attack, doing +1d4 damage if they hit but giving you advantage on your next roll against them
Stoop to your level and respond in kind
Spend a few moments fuming, sputtering or controlling their temper

title: Under Your Skin
description: When you engage an NPC in conversation, you can ask the GM 1 of these and get an honest answer:

bullets: What are they expecting me to do?
What, in general, are they trying to hide?
What do they want to happen?

title: Improved Stat
description: Increase one of your stats by +1 (to a max of +2)

title: Superior Stat (Requires level 6+)
description: Increase one of your stats by +1 (to a max of +3)

title: Pants on Fire (Requires level 6+)
description: When you Defy Danger, Persuade or Interfere by being deceitful, you have advantage.  When another move (like Seek Insight) allows a player ot ask you a question, you can opt not to answer.

title: Eye on the door (+Intelligence, Requires level 6+)
description: When you and your allies need to get out of here, name your escape route and roll +Intelligence

outcomes.text: You can stay or go but if you go, it costs you - the GM will tell you what (or who) you leave behind or take with you.

title: All in the Wrist
description: Any knife or dagger gets the thrown tag in your hands. Also, you keep a number of iron throwing blades (near) on you; they don't take up space in your inventory. Your ammo replenishes whenever you Outfit.

title: Ambush (+Dexterity)
description: When you attack someone up close and they don't see it coming, deal your damage or roll +Dexterity.

bullets: Deal +1d4 damage
Stop them from making noise/raising an alarm
Slip away before they can react
Create an opportunity; you or an ally gains advantage on the next move to act on it

title: Burgle (+Intelligence)
description: When you break into a place or thing, roll +Intelligence.

bullets: It took a fair bit of time/effort
You made a lot of noise
You broke something on your way in
You had to use up 1d4 small items (say what)

title: Catlike
description: When you carry a light load and move with care, you make no noise. When you keep still in shadows or darkness, you remain unseen until you draw attention to yourself, move positions, or attack.

title: Perceptive
description: When you Seek Insight, you may ask 1 additional question. Even on a 6-, you can ask 1 question (though you might not like how you learn the answer).

title: Parry & Riposte (Requires Skill at Arms)
description: When you Defend with a weapon that you can wield quickly, you can spend 1 Readiness to both halve an attack's effects/damage and strike back at the attacker (deal your damage with disadvantage), instead of spending 1 Readiness for each.

title: Battle Dancer (Requires level 6+ and Skill at Arms)
description: When you roll +Dexterity to Clash, on a 12+ you deal your damage, avoid your enemy's attack, and impress/embarrass/overawe your foes.

title: Cheap Shot (Requires level 6+ and Ambush)
description: When you Ambush with a hand or precise weapon, you have advantage on your damage roll.

title: Second Intent (Requires level 6+, Parry & Riposte, and Ambush)
description: When you Defend and spend 1 Readiness to Parry & Riposte, also pick 1 option from the Ambush list.

title: Slippery (Requires level 6+)
description: When you roll to escape being caught or controlled, treat a 6- as a 7-9. On a 12+, say how you turn the tables or use the circumstances to your advantage.

title: Free Running
description: When you carry a light load and move with speed and grace, gain advantage on any move to surmount or bypass a physical obstacle.

title: Irresistible
description: When you interact with someone, you can ask their player if they find you attractive and get an honest answer (usually 'yes'). When you Persuade by using your considerable charms as leverage, you have advantage.

title: Light Fingers (+Dexterity)
description: When you perform sleight of hand on an unwary mark, you succeed and no one's the wiser. If you're being watched, roll +Dexterity.

outcomes.text: You succeed and no one's the wiser
You succeed OR no one's the wiser (your choice)

title: Instinct (Choose 1)
description: You can change on levelling or when appropriate story events affect you.
pickOne: CONSCIENCE - To feel guilty, to try to do right.
FREEDOM - To chafe against rules, expectations, obligations.
COMFORT - To enjoy yourself and avoid hardship.
PRESTIGE - To impress others, to build a name for yourself.
